content.body: here is a build of the spec where `[[FieldNames]]` are clickable to highlight like variable names: https://bakkot.github.io/ecma262-previews/highlight-brackets/
content.formatted_body: here is a build of the spec where [[FieldNames]] are clickable to highlight like variable names: https://bakkot.github.io/ecma262-previews/highlight-brackets/

content.body: it's mostly intended for Temporal and 402, which have a lot more algorithms with a lot of different field names
but it seems like it is not harmful for 262?
anyway requesting feedback before I commit to this in ecmarkup
like what's different in 262 from that change
if you click `[[FieldNames]]` they highlight like variables do
content.formatted_body: if you click [[FieldNames]] they highlight like variables do

content.body: oh interesting, but they highlight across the entire spec, not just one algorithm
that seems useful but also sort of implies that field names should be unique for a given purpose?
ljharb: there's no way to tell two fields apart if they have the same name though
content.formatted_body: ljharb: there's no way to tell two fields apart if they have the same name though

content.body: right, hence implying they should be unique :-)
like AB and SAB should share a name but like `[[Value]]` shouldn't be used for more than just completion records, or something
content.formatted_body: like AB and SAB should share a name but like [[Value]] shouldn't be used for more than just completion records, or something

content.body: I think it will be hard to make the field names globally unique while also not making them super verbose
ljharb: though now that I check it out, I only see it highlighting a field in a single algorithm at any given time
content.formatted_body: ljharb: though now that I check it out, I only see it highlighting a field in a single algorithm at any given time

content.body: that makes this much less of a problem
